string.name: gote
string.comment: Should be 'Gote', unless equivalent written differently exists (ex. 後手 in JP; し - ši in CZ instead of shi)

string.name: sente
string.comment: Should be 'Sente', unless equivalent written differently exists (ex. 先手 in JP; し - ši in CZ instead of shi)

string.name: shitate
string.comment: Should be 'Shitate', unless equivalent written differently exists (ex. 下手 in JP; し - ši in CZ instead of shi) - https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Handicap_(shogi)

string.name: uwate
string.comment: Should be 'Uwate', unless equivalent written differently exists (ex. 上手 in JP; し - ši in CZ instead of shi) - https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Handicap_(shogi)

Non están permitidos os ordenadores ou os xogadores asistidos por eles. Por favor uses a asistencia de módulos de xadrez, bases de datos ou dotros xogadores durante a partida. Lembra tamén que o uso de múltiples contas está altamente desaconsellado e que o uso abusivo deste tipo de contas pode conducir á suspensión
Discusións sobre shogi e comentarios sobre o desenvolvemento de Lishogi
Só poden cambiar as letras entre minúsculas e maiúsculas. Por exemplo de \"xoanninguen\" a \"XoanNinguen\".
Cambiar o teu nome de usuario. Só se pode facer unha vez e só está permitido cambiar minúsculas por maiúsculas e viceversa.

A túa puntuación %1$s (%2$s) é demasiado baixa
Shogi libre en liña. Xoga ó shogi cunha interface limpa. Sen rexistrarse, sen anuncios, sen necesidade de complementos. Xoga ó shogi contra o ordenador, amigos ou rivais ó chou.

O shogi (\"将棋\" en xaponés) é un xogo de mesa de estratexia para dúas persoas que se practica no Xapón dende hai séculos. Adoita chamarse \"xadrez xaponés\" por ser semellante ó xadrez occidental, pero ten particularidades que o converten nun xogo independente por dereito propio.
Se non estás familiarizado coas regras do shogi, bótalle unha ollada a - %s.

resources.string: Pega o PGN dunha partida para obter unha versión navegable, análise por ordenador, sala de conversa do xogo e unha ligazón para compartila.

Preme no taboleiro para facer a túa xogada e demostrar que es humano.
Por favor resolve o CAPTCHA de shogi.
Escolle un nome seguro para o torneo.
Calquera comportamento minimamente inadecuado podería levar ao peche da túa conta.
Deixar en branco para poñerlle ó torneo o nome dun Grande Mestre notable.
Se estableces condicións de entrada, o teu torneo terá menos xogadores.
Fai que o torneo sexa privado e restrinxe o acceso cun contrasinal

Paste the link to the game(s) and explain what is wrong about this user\'s behaviour. Don\'t just say \"they cheat\", but tell us how you came to this conclusion. Your report will be processed faster if written in English.
Please provide at least one link to a cheated game.
Write a private note about this user
Let other players invite you to study
All information is public and optional.
Talk about yourself, your interests, what you like in shogi, your favourite openings, players, ...
No internet connection. You can still play offline from the menu.
You are now connected to lishogi.org
This email address is not acceptable. Please double-check it, and try again.
This email address is already taken
This is already your email address
%1$s is a free (%2$s), libre, no-ads, open source shogi server.
This simultaneous exhibition does not exist.
Simuls involve a single player facing several players at once.
Out of 50 opponents, Fischer won 47 games, drew 2 and lost 1.
The concept is taken from real world events. In real life, this involves the simul host moving from table to table to play a single move.
When the simul starts, every player starts a game with the host, who starts as sente. The simul ends when all games are complete.
Simuls are always casual. Rematches, takebacks and adding time are disabled.
When you create a Simul, you get to play several players at once.
If you select several variants, each player gets to choose which one to play.
The more players you take on, the more time you may need.
You may add extra time to your clock to help you cope with the simul.
Anything you want to tell the participants?
Shogi tournaments featuring various time controls and variants
Play fast-paced shogi tournaments! Join an official scheduled tournament, or create your own. Bullet, Blitz, Classical and more options available for endless shogi fun.
The tournament may have been cancelled if all players left before it started.
You are better than %1$s of %2$s players.
You do not have an established %s rating.
We\'ve sent you an email. Click the link in the email to activate your account.
If you don\'t see the email, check other places it might be, like your junk, spam, social, or other folders.
We\'ve sent an email to %s. Click the link in the email to reset your password.
By registering, you agree to be bound by our %s.

Time to process a move on Lishogi\'s server
You can also scroll over the board to move in the game.
Press shift+click or right-click to draw circles and arrows on the board.
You have already registered the email: %s
This is about safety. In kid mode, all site communications are disabled. Enable this for your children and school students, to protect them from other internet users.
In kid mode, the Lishogi logo gets a %s icon, so you know your kids are safe.

We aim to provide a pleasant shogi experience for everyone.
To that effect, we must ensure that all players follow good practice.
When a potential problem is detected, we display this message.
Try to win (or at least draw) every game you play.
Resign lost games (don\'t let the clock run down).
We apologise for the temporary inconvenience,
and wish you great games on lishogi.org.

I agree that I will always be respectful to other players.

Very fast games: less than 5 minutes
Correspondence games: one or several days per move
